verses.verse: And Sarah<WH8283> was<WH1961> a hundred<WH3967> and seven<WH7651> and twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> old:<WH2416> these were the years<WH8141> of the life<WH2416> of Sarah.<WH8283>

And Sarah<WH8283> died<WH4191> in Kirjath-arba;<WH7153> the same<WH1931> is Hebron<WH2275> in the land<WH776> of Canaan:<WH3667> and Abraham<WH85> came<WH935> to mourn<WH5594> for Sarah,<WH8283> and to weep<WH1058> for her.
And Abraham<WH85> stood up<WH6965> from before<WH4480> <WH5921> <WH6440> his dead,<WH4191> and spoke<WH1696> unto<WH413> the sons<WH1121> of Heth,<WH2845> saying,<WH559>

I <WH595> am a stranger<WH1616> and a sojourner<WH8453> with<WH5973> you: give<WH5414> me a possession<WH272> of a burial place<WH6913> with<WH5973> you, that I may bury<WH6912> my dead<WH4191> out of my sight.<WH4480> <WH6440>
And the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845> answered<WH6030> <WH853> Abraham,<WH85> saying<WH559> unto him,

Hear <WH8085> us, my lord:<WH113> thou<WH859> art a mighty<WH430> prince<WH5387> among<WH8432> us: in the choice<WH4005> of our sepulchers<WH6913> bury<WH6912> <WH853> thy dead;<WH4191> none<WH376> <WH3808> of<WH4480> us shall withhold<WH3607> from<WH4480> thee<WH853> his sepulcher,<WH6913> but that thou mayest bury<WH4480> <WH6912> thy dead.<WH4191>
And Abraham<WH85> stood up,<WH6965> and bowed himself<WH7812> to the people<WH5971> of the land,<WH776> even to the children<WH1121> of Heth.<WH2845>

And he communed<WH1696> with<WH854> them, saying,<WH559> If<WH518> it be<WH3426> <WH853> your mind<WH5315> that I should bury<WH6912> <WH853> my dead<WH4191> out of my sight;<WH4480> <WH6440> hear<WH8085> me, and entreat<WH6293> for me to Ephron<WH6085> the son<WH1121> of Zohar,<WH6714>

That he may give<WH5414> me<WH853> the cave<WH4631> of Machpelah,<WH4375> which<WH834> he hath, which<WH834> is in the end<WH7097> of his field;<WH7704> for as much money<WH3701> as it is worth<WH4392> he shall give<WH5414> it me for a possession<WH272> of a burial place<WH6913> amongst<WH8432> you.

And Ephron<WH6085> dwelt<WH3427> among<WH8432> the children<WH1121> of Heth:<WH2845> and Ephron<WH6085> the Hittite<WH2850> answered<WH6030> <WH853> Abraham<WH85> in the audience<WH241> of the children<WH1121> of Heth,<WH2845> even of all<WH3605> that went in<WH935> at the gate<WH8179> of his city,<WH5892> saying,<WH559>

Nay, <WH3808> my lord,<WH113> hear<WH8085> me: the field<WH7704> give<WH5414> I thee, and the cave<WH4631> that<WH834> is therein, I give<WH5414> it thee; in the presence<WH5869> of the sons<WH1121> of my people<WH5971> give<WH5414> I it thee: bury<WH6912> thy dead.<WH4191>
And Abraham<WH85> bowed down himself<WH7812> before<WH6440> the people<WH5971> of the land.<WH776>

And he spoke<WH1696> unto<WH413> Ephron<WH6085> in the audience<WH241> of the people<WH5971> of the land,<WH776> saying,<WH559> But<WH389> if<WH518> thou<WH859> wilt give it, I pray thee,<WH3863> hear<WH8085> me: I will give<WH5414> thee money<WH3701> for the field;<WH7704> take<WH3947> it of<WH4480> me, and I will bury<WH6912> <WH853> my dead<WH4191> there.<WH8033>
And Ephron<WH6085> answered<WH6030> <WH853> Abraham,<WH85> saying<WH559> unto him,

My lord,<WH113> hearken<WH8085> unto me: the land<WH776> is worth four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of silver;<WH3701> what<WH4100> is that<WH1931> between<WH996> me and thee? bury<WH6912> therefore thy dead.<WH4191>

And Abraham<WH85> hearkened<WH8085> unto<WH413> Ephron;<WH6085> and Abraham<WH85> weighed<WH8254> to Ephron<WH6085> <WH853> the silver,<WH3701> which<WH834> he had named<WH1696> in the audience<WH241> of the sons<WH1121> of Heth,<WH2845> four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of silver,<WH3701> current<WH5674> money with the merchant.<WH5503>

And the field<WH7704> of Ephron,<WH6085> which<WH834> was in Machpelah,<WH4375> which<WH834> was before<WH6440> Mamre,<WH4471> the field,<WH7704> and the cave<WH4631> which<WH834> was therein, and all<WH3605> the trees<WH6086> that<WH834> were in the field,<WH7704> that<WH834> were in all<WH3605> the borders<WH1366> round about,<WH5439> were made sure<WH6965>
Unto Abraham<WH85> for a possession<WH4736> in the presence<WH5869> of the children<WH1121> of Heth,<WH2845> before all<WH3605> that went in<WH935> at the gate<WH8179> of his city.<WH5892>

And after<WH310> this,<WH3651> Abraham<WH85> buried<WH6912> <WH853> Sarah<WH8283> his wife<WH802> in<WH413> the cave<WH4631> of the field<WH7704> of Machpelah<WH4375> before<WH5921> <WH6440> Mamre:<WH4471> the same<WH1931> is Hebron<WH2275> in the land<WH776> of Canaan.<WH3667>

And the field,<WH7704> and the cave<WH4631> that<WH834> is therein, were made sure<WH6965> unto Abraham<WH85> for a possession<WH272> of a burial place<WH6913> by<WH4480> <WH854> the sons<WH1121> of Heth.<WH2845>
